identificationModule.briefTitle: Immunoglobulin G4 and Immunoglobulin E Antibodies in a Population With Adverse Reactions to Foodstuffs-related Symptoms
identificationModule.officialTitle: Food-specific Immunoglobulin G4 and Immunoglobulin E Antibody Reactions in a Population With Adverse Reactions to Foodstuffs-related Symptoms

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Food Engineer, Master of Food Engineering applied to health

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The aim of this study is to analyze a population with symptoms associated with adverse reactions to foodstuffs (ARFS). To determine the levels of food-specific immunoglobulin G4 (IgG4) and immunoglobulin E (IgE) antibody reactions (AbR).
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Volunteers with symptoms related with adverse reactions to foodstuffs (ARFS) and suspicion of having a food allergy or a food intolerance are enrolled in this study. A 50μl of capillary whole blood is analyzed and the levels of food-specific immunoglobulin G4 (IgG4) or immunoglobulin E (IgE) antibody reactions (AbR) are determined.

interventions.name: Food-specific Immunoglobulin G4 and/or Immunoglobulin E antibody reactions
interventions.description: Immunoassay kits (NutriSMART® and Fastcheckpoc20® In-Vitro Diagnostic kits, DST GmbH, Schwerin, Germany) are performed in a population with suspicion of having a food allergy or a food intolerance with related symptoms.

primaryOutcomes.description: Immunoassay kits (NutriSMART® In-Vitro Diagnostic kit, DST GmbH, Schwerin, Germany) are performed in a population with suspicion of having a food allergy or a food intolerance with related symptoms.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Immunoassay kits (Fastcheckpoc20® In-Vitro Diagnostic kit, DST GmbH, Schwerin, Germany) are performed in a population with suspicion of having a food allergy or a food intolerance with related symptoms.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Adults (\>18 years of age)
* To present symptoms related to adverse reactions to foodstuffs (ARFS)

Exclusion Criteria:

* Antibiotic treatment
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Adults presenting symptoms related to adverse reactions to foodstuffs and/ or with suspicion of having a food allergy or food intolerance
